body_html:
Well, in my case, I'm reimplementing a very similar code to https://github.com/edouardoyallon/scatwave

The idea is to preinitialize some temporary variables that will be widely reused: https://github.com/edouardoyallon/scatwave/blob/master/scatwave_pkg/network_2d_translation.lua#L54-L59 in slice of code like: https://github.com/edouardoyallon/scatwave/blob/master/scatwave_pkg/network_2d_translation.lua#L170

Consequently, I need precisely dictionaries of tensors as buffers in my case. I guess this is particular and not all the modules need this, however some modules that require arrays of tensors could also suffer from this issue. I know also I could hack the code, but this is something inelegant that I want to avoid!
What do you think?

Thanks!
Edouard

body:
Well, in my case, I'm reimplementing a very similar code to https://github.com/edouardoyallon/scatwave 

The idea is to preinitialize some temporary variables that will be widely reused: https://github.com/edouardoyallon/scatwave/blob/master/scatwave_pkg/network_2d_translation.lua#L54-L59 in slice of code like: https://github.com/edouardoyallon/scatwave/blob/master/scatwave_pkg/network_2d_translation.lua#L170

Consequently, I need precisely dictionaries of tensors as buffers in my case. I guess this is particular and not all the modules need this, however some modules that require arrays of tensors could also suffer from this issue. I know also I could hack the code, but this is something inelegant that I want to avoid!
What do you think?

Thanks!
Edouard
